title: Tag : Europe – NBC 6 South Florida
body_text:
-
Trial of Norway's crown princess's son on rape and other charges opens in Oslo
Marius Borg Høiby, the son of Norway’s crown princess, is on trial for charges including rape.
-
Europe's rising diversity not reflected at 2026 Olympics. Culture plays big role
The Olympic rosters of France, Germany and other European winter sports nations are overwhelmingly white and lack immigrant representation.
-
E.U. halts approval of U.S. trade deal after Trump's Greenland tariff threat
The European Union’s legislative body halted work on the final approval and implementation of the trade deal it reached with President Donald Trump.
-
EU to hold emergency meeting on Trump's tariffs over Greenland
The European Union will hold an emergency meeting of its ambassadors in Brussels on Sunday after U.S.
-
Trump says U.S. will ‘do something on Greenland whether they like it or not'
The president’s remarks came three days after the White House said that using the U.S. military is “always an option” for acquiring the Danish territory.
-
Why Greenland is strategically important to Arctic security
Greenland’s strategic location above the Arctic Circle makes it a focal point in global security and trade debates.
-
At least 40 feared dead after fire sweeps through Swiss ski resort bar
At least 40 people are feared dead after a fire swept through a bar during New Year’s Eve celebrations at a Swiss Alpine ski resort, authorities said.
-
Europe will be ‘unrecognizable' in 20 years due to immigration, White House strategy document claims
Political experts told NBC News that the reports’ language regarding “civilization erasure” and immigration echoes “great replacement theory.”
-
Names of 5 million Holocaust victims identified, Israel's Yad Vashem says
Israel’s Holocaust memorial says it has now identified 5 million of the 6 million Jewish victims killed by the Nazis — a milestone made possible through decades of research.
-
Fact focus: A look at Trump's UN claims about irregular migration in Europe
President Donald Trump’s claims about illegal immigration in Europe “like nobody’s ever seen before” contrast the data.
-
Drones shut major airport in ‘serious attack' as U.S. allies weigh tougher Russia action
Authorities did not immediately assign blame Tuesday for the two to three large drones that shut Copenhagen Airport.
-
New European basketball league could launch in 2027 or '28, Adam Silver says
A new basketball league based in Europe that the NBA and FIBA are working together to launch could begin play in 2027 or ’28, but needs sorting out.
-
Tens of thousands join far-right rally in London where Charlie Kirk is being mourned
The “Unite the Kingdom” rally comes amid a surge of nationalism in the U.K., a far-right party topping the polls, and the murder of American conservative activist Charlie Kirk.
-
College of Charleston instructor among victims killed in Lisbon funicular crash
Heather Hall, a member of the faculty of the Department of Teacher Education, was one of 16 people killed in the accident and the only American.
-
Death toll in Lisbon streetcar crash rises to 17 as Portugal observes national day of mourning
The death toll in the crash of a famous Lisbon streetcar popular with tourists has risen to 17 after two of the 23 injured people died in hospital.
-
At least 15 people killed and many injured in crash of funicular railway in Lisbon
At least 15 people were killed and more than a dozen were injured in a crash of the popular funicular railway in Lisbon on Wednesday, according to local authorities.
-
Little legs, big dreams: More than 100 teams compete in international Corgi race
Thousands of Lithuanians gathered in the capital’s largest park on Saturday and Sunday to watch the Welsh corgis compete.
-
European postal services suspend shipment of packages to U.S. over import tariffs
Multiple postal services around Europe say they are suspending the shipment of many packages to the United States amid a lack of clarity over new import duties.
-
Son of Norway's Crown Princess charged with rape & assault
Marius Borg Høiby, son of the Crown Princess of Norway, has been accused of rape and assault. The 28-year-old has been charged with rape, domestic violence as well as other crimes after a year-long investigation, NBC News reports citing a prosecutor.
-
At Europe's melting glaciers, signs of climate peril are everywhere
Europe’s glaciers are shrinking faster than anywhere else on Earth, leaving behind unstable landscapes.
